definition: to achieve the Dao/to become an immortal
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
a just cause enjoys abundant support (idiom); those upholding justice will find help all around

lit. when a man achieves the Dao, his poultry and dogs rise to Heaven (idiom)/fig. to ride on sb else's success/Once one man gets a government position, all his cronies get in too/Once sb has cracked the problem, every Tom, Dick and Harry can do it
pinyin: yi1 ren2 de2 dao4 , ji1 quan3 sheng1 tian1

definition: A just cause attracts much support, an unjust one finds little (idiom, from Mencius)
pinyin: de2 dao4 duo1 zhu4 , shi1 dao4 gua3 zhu4

sentences.english: Employment will shrink in a financial spiral of economic austerity.
sentences.chinese: 在經濟緊縮，金融得道昇天的情況下，就業將很嚴峻。

sentences.english: Road is to promote the growth of total world power Over a long period of time cause success.
sentences.chinese: 道是推動萬物成長總力量得道多助事業成功。

definition: to become immortal
to practice Daoism
to reach illumination (Buddhism)
to become immortal/big promotion/die
Daoist immortal/supernatural entity/(in modern fiction) fairy, elf, leprechaun etc/fig. lighthearted person
Daoist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC), based on the teachings of Laozi or Lao-tze 老子[Lao3 zi3] (c. 500 BC-) and Zhuangzi 庄子 (369-286 BC)
Mahayana, the Great Vehicle/Buddhism based on the Mayahana sutras, as spread to Central Asia, China and beyond/also pr. [Da4 cheng2]
to devote oneself to spiritual development (esp. Buddhism or Daoism)/to devote oneself to perfecting one's art or craft
to become a Buddha/to attain enlightenment
to levitate heavenwards (a Daoist success)/to take off/to soar (of prices)
Daoist immortal/celestial being
founder (of a craft, religious sect etc)
to enter the Way/to become a Daoist
to grow old with unfailing eyes and ears (idiom)
saint/sage/refers to Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]/the current reigning Emperor
to become enlightened (Buddhism)
